abstract: Utah Gov Gary Herbert approves bill that requires doctors to give anesthesia to women having abortion at 20 weeks of pregnancy or later; measure is based on controversial belief that a fetus could feel pain at that time.

headline.print_headline: Utah to Require Anesthesia in Some Abortions
headline.main: Utah to Require Anesthesia in Some Abortions

snippet: The governor of Utah, Gary Herbert, a Republican, has approved a bill that makes Utah the first state to require doctors to give anesthesia to women having an abortion at 20 weeks of pregnancy or later.
lead_paragraph: The governor of Utah, Gary Herbert, a Republican, has approved a bill that makes Utah the first state to require doctors to give anesthesia to women having an abortion at 20 weeks of pregnancy or later.
